page.title: 12HEALTH - SOCIAL WELFARE
page.content: My day to day life is extremely busy and fulfilling. I am a farmer's wife with twin boys and a girl. I run the local Twins Club which aims to give emotional and practical support to parents of twins. Monthly meetings are held to discuss and give advice on the joys and difficulties of coping with and bringing up twins. My husband and I are Registered Foster Parents taking children referred by the Social Services for short stays - this work is very rewarding and enjoyable. I am also a Team Attached Volunteer which involves working closely with social workers and visiting young families with problems and befriending them. I run the Babysitting Circle in our area About 25 families belong and we use a ticket system of repayment so no money is involved. I take my daughter to the Keevil Toddler Group once a week.
